content:
Simple Icons Contribution Contributed to Simple Icons, a popular open-source project that maintains SVG icons for popular brands. Simple Icons is used by millions of developers worldwide and is integrated into numerous frameworks and tools.
Contribution Details Added a new brand icon following project guidelines Ensured SVG optimization and compliance with project standards Passed all automated tests and review requirements Successfully merged into the main repository Technical Process SVG creation and optimization Color code standardization File size optimization Documentation updates
summary:
Simple Icons Contribution

Contributed to Simple Icons, a popular open-source project that maintains SVG icons for popular brands. Simple Icons is used by millions of developers worldwide and is integrated into numerous frameworks and tools.

Contribution Details

  • Ensured SVG optimization and compliance with project standards
  • Passed all automated tests and review requirements

title: Simple Icons Contribution

content:
Simple Icons Website Enhancement Contributed to the Simple Icons website by implementing a fix for the sticky navigation header, ensuring proper text positioning during scrolling.
Contribution Details Fixed CSS issues causing text overlap in the sticky header Adjusted padding and top position values for optimal display Modified the navigation component’s scroll behavior PR merged successfully Technical Implementation Updated stylesheet.css with refined padding values Fine-tuned the sticky positioning parameters Maintained responsive design across different viewports Ensured backward compatibility Impact This enhancement improves the website’s user experience by preventing text overlap issues in the navigation header, resulting in cleaner and more professional presentation during page scrolling.
summary:
Simple Icons Website Enhancement

Contributed to the Simple Icons website by implementing a fix for the sticky navigation header, ensuring proper text positioning during scrolling.

Contribution Details

  • Fixed CSS issues causing text overlap in the sticky header
  • Adjusted padding and top position values for optimal display
  • Modified the navigation component’s scroll behavior
  • PR merged successfully

Technical Implementation

  • Updated stylesheet.css with refined padding values
  • Fine-tuned the sticky positioning parameters
  • Maintained responsive design across different viewports
  • Ensured backward compatibility

Impact

This enhancement improves the website’s user experience by preventing text overlap issues in the navigation header, resulting in cleaner and more professional presentation during page scrolling.
title: Simple Icons Website Contribution

content:
Albion Equipment A comprehensive mobile utility application for Albion Online players that streamlines equipment management and provides essential game information. With over 45k downloads, it has become a trusted tool for the Albion community.
Features Equipment Manager: Create, save, and share custom builds Item Encyclopedia: Complete database with detailed information Farming Timers: Track crop and animal breeding progress Multi-language Support: Available in 9 languages Technical Stack Frontend: Vue.js with Vuetify Mobile: Capacitor for native Android features Backend: Docker containerized services Database: Regular updates via game files parsing Available Languages Fully translated interface and database in:
English French German Russian Polish Portuguese Spanish Italian Bahasa Indonesia
summary:
Albion Equipment

A comprehensive mobile utility application for Albion Online players that streamlines equipment management and provides essential game information. With over 45k downloads, it has become a trusted tool for the Albion community.

Features

  • Equipment Manager: Create, save, and share custom builds
  • Item Encyclopedia: Complete database with detailed information
  • Farming Timers: Track crop and animal breeding progress
  • Multi-language Support: Available in 9 languages

Technical Stack

  • Frontend: Vue.js with Vuetify
  • Mobile: Capacitor for native Android features
  • Backend: Docker containerized services
  • Database: Regular updates via game files parsing

Available Languages

Fully translated interface and database in:
title: Albion Equipment

content:
During my master’s degree, I worked on various projects across different domains:
Web Development Time Manager: Built a management application using Vue.js, Elixir Phoenix, PostgreSQL, Docker, Ionic, and Kubernetes The Count Of Money: Developed a cryptocurrency platform with Vue.js, Node.js Express, MongoDB, and Docker Epic Road Trip: Created a trip planning website using React, Node.js, MongoDB, Redux, Cypress, and Mocha End Of Study Project: Implemented a local handmade products marketplace using React Next.js, Nest.js, PostgreSQL, and Docker AI & Big Data Zoidberg 2: Developed X-ray image analysis for pneumonia detection using NumPy, Pandas, TensorFlow, Matplotlib, and Scikit-learn Travel Order Resolver: Built a voice-command route optimization system using NumPy, SciPy, Geograpy, and spaCy Recommander: Created a product recommendation system using Pandas, Seaborn, Matplotlib, and K-means clustering Network & System Administration DevOps: Implemented shared hosting infrastructure using GitLab CI/CD, Debian, and Ansible
summary:
During my master’s degree, I worked on various projects across different domains:

Web Development

  • Time Manager: Built a management application using Vue.js, Elixir Phoenix, PostgreSQL, Docker, Ionic, and Kubernetes
  • The Count Of Money: Developed a cryptocurrency platform with Vue.js, Node.js Express, MongoDB, and Docker
  • Epic Road Trip: Created a trip planning website using React, Node.js, MongoDB, Redux, Cypress, and Mocha
  • End Of Study Project: Implemented a local handmade products marketplace using React Next.js, Nest.js, PostgreSQL, and Docker

AI & Big Data

  • Zoidberg 2: Developed X-ray image analysis for pneumonia detection using NumPy, Pandas, TensorFlow, Matplotlib, and Scikit-learn
  • Travel Order Resolver: Built a voice-command route optimization system using NumPy, SciPy, Geograpy, and spaCy
  • Recommander: Created a product recommendation system using Pandas, Seaborn, Matplotlib, and K-means clustering

Network & System Administration

  • DevOps: Implemented shared hosting infrastructure using GitLab CI/CD, Debian, and Ansible

content:
Context Joined a team of 3 developers to develop an Android application for FlexFuel Company, a leader in engine decarbonization solutions. The application aimed to analyze engine clogging via the OBD port and guide users through the data collection process. This solution was part of enhancing the engine decarbonization process, a proprietary technology by FlexFuel Company.
Responsibilities Development and Optimization Enhanced the engine clogging analysis system via the OBD port Optimized application performance Developed user interfaces Implemented a data collection guide Architecture and Design Integrated with the OBD protocol Designed algorithms for engine data analysis Developed features using Kotlin Organization and Methodology Collaborated within a team of 3 developers Participated in team meetings Documented developed features
summary:
Context

Joined a team of 3 developers to develop an Android application for FlexFuel Company, a leader in engine decarbonization solutions. The application aimed to analyze engine clogging via the OBD port and guide users through the data collection process. This solution was part of enhancing the engine decarbonization process, a proprietary technology by FlexFuel Company.

Responsibilities

Development and Optimization

  • Enhanced the engine clogging analysis system via the OBD port
  • Optimized application performance
  • Developed user interfaces
  • Implemented a data collection guide

Architecture and Design

  • Integrated with the OBD protocol
  • Designed algorithms for engine data analysis
  • Developed features using Kotlin

Organization and Methodology

  • Collaborated within a team of 3 developers
  • Participated in team meetings
  • Documented developed features
title: Android Developer

content:
Project The engine decarbonization application was developed for FlexFuel Company, a leader in engine decarbonization, EGR valve and DPF cleaning, and bioethanol kits for eco-driving. When I joined the development team of 3 developers, the application was still under development. My primary role was to make adjustments and improvements to the engine clogging analysis component.
Context The application’s objective was to retrieve data from the OBD port, analyze it, and provide relevant results. It also guided users throughout the data collection process. The engine decarbonization process is proprietary to FlexFuel Company, and the application was designed as an analytical tool to enhance this process. The team consisted of 3 developers.
Responsibilities Design and Development Created a Kotlin animation library Designed to be reusable and easily integrable into other company applications Synchronized with the same library in iOS Swift Updated an application cataloging the library’s animations Organization and Methodology Participated in daily stand-ups Facilitated brainstorming sessions Presented the final product Authored documentation
summary:
Project

The engine decarbonization application was developed for FlexFuel Company, a leader in engine decarbonization, EGR valve and DPF cleaning, and bioethanol kits for eco-driving. When I joined the development team of 3 developers, the application was still under development. My primary role was to make adjustments and improvements to the engine clogging analysis component.

Context

The application’s objective was to retrieve data from the OBD port, analyze it, and provide relevant results. It also guided users throughout the data collection process. The engine decarbonization process is proprietary to FlexFuel Company, and the application was designed as an analytical tool to enhance this process. The team consisted of 3 developers.
title: Android Developer

content:
Project Development of a mobile application designed for construction tradespeople to simplify the generation of quotes. The application allows users to create accurate quotes using an interactive renovation plan, offering an intuitive solution for managing construction projects.
Context The application was designed to streamline the quoting process for tradespeople by providing a user-friendly and interactive solution. This was the development team’s first experience using Nuxt.js. Close collaboration with the design team provided interactive mockups that guided development. The team consisted of 1 to 2 developers.
Responsibilities Application Architecture Designed the overall architecture of the mobile application Defined key components Structured data flows Front-End Development Implemented the interactive renovation plan map Integrated features for entering project details Developed user interfaces Design and Interface Collaborated with the design team Translated functional requirements into interactive mockups Created cohesive and aesthetically pleasing interface elements
summary:
Project

Development of a mobile application designed for construction tradespeople to simplify the generation of quotes. The application allows users to create accurate quotes using an interactive renovation plan, offering an intuitive solution for managing construction projects.

Context

The application was designed to streamline the quoting process for tradespeople by providing a user-friendly and interactive solution. This was the development team’s first experience using Nuxt.js. Close collaboration with the design team provided interactive mockups that guided development. The team consisted of 1 to 2 developers.

content:
Project Development of an application enabling remote unlocking of mailboxes for a major player in the manufacturing of security locks and mailboxes. The project aimed to provide users with a secure and convenient solution.
Context The project was carried out within a team of 2 developers. My primary role was to develop the front-end features of the application, ensuring an intuitive and efficient user interface.
Responsibilities Front-End Development Created intuitive user interfaces Developed views for the mobile application Implemented remote unlocking functionalities Optimized the user experience Design and Integration Designed responsive interfaces Integrated React and React Native components Established interactions with the locking system Organization Collaborated within a team of 2 developers Documented the developed features

content:
Project Leroy Merlin Studio is a platform designed to support individuals in their renovation projects. It organizes the process into five key steps: online project simulation, consultation with an expert, home visits, detailed quote and schedule delivery, and weekly work progress tracking. The platform aims to simplify the customer experience while enhancing internal team efficiency.
Context A long-term project carried out within a team of 10 people, including 7 developers. As a senior front-end developer, I was responsible for validating pull requests and ensuring code quality. The project required close collaboration with the team to continuously improve the platform.
Responsibilities Front-End Development Implemented new user-oriented features Refactored code to improve structure Implemented Figma designs using Angular components Resolved critical production bugs Enhanced the quote generation platform Quality and Testing Established cross-testing across the application Validated and reviewed pull requests Maintained code quality standards Continuous Integration Optimized GitHub Actions pipelines Managed development and pre-production environments Configured Jenkins and Turbine tools
summary:
Project

Leroy Merlin Studio is a platform designed to support individuals in their renovation projects. It organizes the process into five key steps: online project simulation, consultation with an expert, home visits, detailed quote and schedule delivery, and weekly work progress tracking. The platform aims to simplify the customer experience while enhancing internal team efficiency.

Context

A long-term project carried out within a team of 10 people, including 7 developers. As a senior front-end developer, I was responsible for validating pull requests and ensuring code quality. The project required close collaboration with the team to continuously improve the platform.
title: Front-End Developer

content:
Project The primary objective of this project is to design a B2C commercial extranet for AluK, enabling the company’s sales team to track orders for all clients worldwide. This extranet aims to provide a robust and scalable platform to manage internationalization and specific needs related to global order management.
Context AluK, a leader in aluminum joinery design, seeks to establish a centralized system for its sales team to monitor client orders globally. The development team, consisting of four developers, faces the challenge of handling the platform’s internationalization, with a focus on language management to ensure a consistent user experience across different regions of the world.
Responsibilities Front-End Development Implementation of multilingual features Development of global search components Management of international currencies Creation of adaptive user interfaces Back-End Development Creation of new API routes Integration with Sequelize for database management Implementation of international order management Configuration of the language management system Maintenance and Optimization Bug identification and resolution Performance optimization Technical documentation Support for international users
summary:
Project

The primary objective of this project is to design a B2C commercial extranet for AluK, enabling the company’s sales team to track orders for all clients worldwide. This extranet aims to provide a robust and scalable platform to manage internationalization and specific needs related to global order management.

Context

AluK, a leader in aluminum joinery design, seeks to establish a centralized system for its sales team to monitor client orders globally. The development team, consisting of four developers, faces the challenge of handling the platform’s internationalization, with a focus on language management to ensure a consistent user experience across different regions of the world.
title: Fullstack Developer

content:
Project Development of a comprehensive extranet for managing workshops, designed for the Force Femmes association. The platform enables the organization and tracking of workshop sessions offered by volunteers, specifically tailored for women over 45 seeking employment. The system includes six distinct applications covering application management, workshop scheduling, and statistical report generation.
Context An evolving project that started with an initial version developed in 7 months and was continuously improved to meet user needs and the association’s growth. As the lead developer, I was responsible for client communication and supervising development tasks, including those handled by junior developers. The team ranged from 1 to 3 developers.
Responsibilities Architecture and Development Designed and developed 6 interconnected applications Migrated from Webpack to Vite for improved build performance Set up unit testing with Jest and code coverage configuration Configured ESLint and Prettier for code quality and consistency Created 2 APIs for integration Developed 4 batch scripts Managed the application’s data architecture Implemented a monorepo with Lerna to unify projects Set up CI/CD pipelines using GitHub Actions for automated testing and deployment Feature Development Implemented core features for all workshop applications Developed session management systems Created user interfaces tailored to specific requirements Wrote comprehensive technical documentation on GitHub Wiki Migration and Supervision Planned and executed data migration from the previous extranet Supervised and trained junior developers Maintained architectural consistency across applications Automated deployment workflows with GitHub Actions
summary:
Project

Development of a comprehensive extranet for managing workshops, designed for the Force Femmes association. The platform enables the organization and tracking of workshop sessions offered by volunteers, specifically tailored for women over 45 seeking employment. The system includes six distinct applications covering application management, workshop scheduling, and statistical report generation.

Context

An evolving project that started with an initial version developed in 7 months and was continuously improved to meet user needs and the association’s growth. As the lead developer, I was responsible for client communication and supervising development tasks, including those handled by junior developers. The team ranged from 1 to 3 developers.
title: Lead Fullstack Developer

content:
Context Web development internship at DREAL Bretagne, focused on modernizing applications used by DIR Ouest. The primary objective was to ensure compatibility with new production environments while improving the security and performance of the applications.
Responsibilities Design and Development Migrated websites to new environments Upgraded operating systems to the latest Debian version Updated applications to the latest PHP version Upgraded databases to the latest PostgreSQL version Infrastructure and Deployment Initialized Debian environments Performed security updates Hosted and exposed the upgraded websites Organization and Methodology Pair programming Authored technical documentation
summary:
Context

Web development internship at DREAL Bretagne, focused on modernizing applications used by DIR Ouest. The primary objective was to ensure compatibility with new production environments while improving the security and performance of the applications.

Responsibilities

Design and Development

  • Migrated websites to new environments
  • Upgraded operating systems to the latest Debian version
  • Updated applications to the latest PHP version
  • Upgraded databases to the latest PostgreSQL version

  • Initialized Debian environments
